snippet.title: Save Your Money: Celebrity Endorsements Not Worth The Cost
snippet.description: After helping launch more than 500 products, I’ve come to this conclusion: If a product is really strong, you don’t need a celebrity to sell it to consumers. According to a study that appeared in the Social Influence journal, celebrity endorsements are just not worth the cost. Rather than spend too much [...] read »

snippet.title: Lou Reed And The Problem With The Innovation Imperative
snippet.description: People usually think it’s best to be the first to hit the market with a disruptive innovation. But more often than not, the advantages don’t pan out. The career of the late Lou Reed reveals the dark side of the innovation imperative and the disadvantages that come with being a first mover. read »
